gui

Enum STATE

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<STATE>
      • gui.STATE
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<STATE>

    public enum STATE
extends java.lang.Enum<STATE>
    to see what command user was currently using different commands result in different action from GUI
    Author:
    Ramon

      • values

        public static STATE[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (STATE c : STATE.values())
    System.out.println(c);

        public static STATE valueOf(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the enum constant with the specified name
        Throws:

        public static void setState(STATE newState,
            boolean isCommandSent)
        set the curState to newState and update the command if string is not received.
        Parameters:
        newState -
        isCommandSent - true: the user has sent the command and the command is set. false: no command from users

      • getEndedString

        public static java.lang.String getEndedString(boolean isOneTask)
        This function returns the ending statement of the feedback which is different for each command and for the different number of tasks. For example, if the current state is “add” and “one” task is added, it will return “was added.”\
        Parameters:
        isOneTask - true: singular false:plural.
        Returns:
        String that will appear after task detail.

      • checkCommand

        public static STATE checkCommand(java.lang.String curText)
        This function acts as a filter to extract command from the string and to check which state that command belongs to
        Parameters:
        curText - text that needs extracting.
        Returns:
        state from extracting curText

      • getCommand

        public static java.lang.String getCommand()
        get the command string.
        Returns:
        command string

      • getFeedbackText

        public static java.lang.String getFeedbackText()
        This function provides valid feedback that do not require task detail to be shown
        Returns:
        string to be shown on feedback

      • showOwnTasks

        public static boolean showOwnTasks()
        for checking which state needs to show their own tasks which result from their operation.
        Returns:
        true if it has its own task to be shown
